question: Are integrins part of the extracellular matrix?
ideal_answer: Yes, 	integrins are a central family of extracellular matrix receptors.

snippets.text: Several constituents of the ECM provide adhesive cues, which serve as binding sites for cell trans-membrane receptors, such as integrins.
